title: Vex - Anonymous Video Answers
memo: I keep thinking about how people are scared to ask real questions online. What if we could get honest answers from real people without anyone knowing who's asking? Like a therapist explaining what anxiety actually feels like, or a firefighter talking about their first call. Just real people sharing real experiences.
implementation: Start simple - just let people upload short video answers
Keep it anonymous so people feel safe to be honest
Maybe verify some experts so we know the advice is good
Focus on quality answers, not how many followers someone has
Let the community decide what's worth watching

title: Whispurr - Ephemeral Messenger
memo: What if we had a messenger where conversations don't stick around forever? Like for when you want to talk about something sensitive but don't want it saved in a permanent record. All chats disappear after 24 hours unless you want them to stay.
implementation: Start with simple 1-on-1 chats that auto-delete
Add a 'burner message' feature for read-once messages
Maybe add emoji masks so people can't see what you're typing if they look over your shoulder
Keep it simple - no cloud backup, everything stays on your phone
Focus on teens and young adults who want digital lightness

title: Circles - Community Platform
memo: I keep seeing people struggle to manage their communities online. What if we had a platform where organizers could control exactly how their groups work? Like setting rules about what people can share, when conversations expire, and who can join.
implementation: Start with basic group management - who can join, what they can post
Add features for community managers to control the conversation
Maybe let groups have different rules for different times
Focus on people who run study groups, clubs, or professional communities
Keep it simple but powerful for organizers who need control
